transcript:
Irri- tability? Anger? Women?" He went over his vices in his mind, not knowing to which of them to give the pre-eminence. 
"Women," he said in a low, scarcely audible voice. 
The Mason did not move and for a long time said nothing after this answer. At last he moved up to Pierre and, taking the kerchief that lay on the table, again bound his eyes. 
"For the last time I say to you turn all your attention upon yourself, put a bridle on your senses, and seek blessedness, not in passion but in
